Breed Specific Characteristics
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Breed Specific Characteristics
By The D on Thursday, October 24, 2002 - 11:54 am:

Ok, I've been noticing this for a while, and it's been getting me mad at times.

Ok, so I've raised a nice First Gen Hare for the Fast Footwork char, tried to put it on my Lesi, and what a suprise.....It did'nt go on. So, I tried putting it on my Gitan, making it look even faster than ever, but whad'ya know.... It did'nt pick it up. So I figured, there are chars that are breed specific. I'm not talking about the battle chars, such as the secrets and wisdoms, but like armor and thick fur. (DB you should know what passes on to what with your DEF Chars).

But my point, I think this would make an interesting post to see what passes on to what breed. So I just want to see what you guys think and if you'd like to get this done. I have nothing really great to do but raise my BEWD, but it can wait for a while, because I'd really like to get this up.

By Deadbuffalo on Thursday, October 24, 2002 - 01:31 pm:

I'll confirm that from my def. char research, certain monsters are not capable of recieving certain characteristics (from hearts). In my experiance, every monster can receive Armor from a heart, but the other def. chars vary from species to species (hence why some monsters can get four, and others only 2). I suspect that this is true with other characteristics too.

I know that when I made Pokylyps, the heart I created for him used the Jell/Brilla, because Jell/Brilla starts off with the characteristic Sniper. Lisa had hyped up this char and had told me of a golem she had that had started with it. I was disappointed when I found out that the char did not pass on to Pokylyps. So it could be that certain characteristics won't pass down from a monster if they are specific to that breed (as in EVERY monster of that specific breed will have that char)

I am unsure if Hare's fast footworks is one of these characteristics, and the only way to find out is to try it on every breed ( I guess you can stop trying after trying it on 28 different ones J )

Well, I'll see what happens, and help out, cause I think this is a pretty interesting and helpfull topic when completed. It could save some time in creating a heart.

By Pixie Misa on Friday, July 30, 2004 - 05:54 pm:

I've had fast footwork pass on to a pixie. :)

I passed armour to a Avalanche beaclon/ Brillia from a durahan durahan/morx and armour aswell as the beaclon's tough skin to a zan/Goat I don't know what they're called and the same two characteristics to a kuririn suzirin/Kalaragi
